Recipe.title: BBQ Ribs to Di For
Recipe.Description:
Before they were married Di and Ransom had a BBQ Rips bake-off with missionaries as the judges. Ransom did the Slow Cooker BBQ Spare Ribs recipe. Di did one similar to this one. She won, but then (a long time later) Di told Ransom that her sauce recipe was something like: "Buy a bottle of Tony Roma BBQ Sauce".
Ransom tried her method and found it did give the ribs a great consistency, so, after several attempts, we came up with this recipe to go with her cooking instructions.

section.title: Ribs
section.instruction: Cut ⅔ Onion into discs about ¼&inch; thick, then separate the discs into rings.
Spread the Onions around on the bottom of 9&inch; &by; 13&inch; baking pan.

Place Ribs over Onions, with the bones showing on top.
(You may need to squish them together to get them to fit.)
Sprinkle Onion Soup Mix over wet Ribs.
Gently, remove Ribs and Onions from pan and place them onto a platter or plate, pour out all the water, then replace the Onions.
One-by-one, coat each Rib with Sauce and replace it in baking pan.
Evenly spread any leftover Sauce over top of the ribs.
Without foil, bake at 425° for 20 minutes.

section.title: Sauce
section.instruction: Mince ⅓ Onion (Chop it very finely.)
Put all ingredients into a saucepan.
Reduce heat, cover with a lid and let simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Turn off burner and let Sauce sit.

Notes.note: Do the first part of the Ribs (steps 1-8), then, during the baking (step 8) make the Sauce and let it sit until it is time to use it.

When serving, place the Ribs on a platter, then pour/scrape the leftover Sauce into a bowl with a gravy ladle. It can be used by those that want extra Sauce, or it is great over a baked potato with sour cream.
In step 8 of the Ribs instructions, you can take the water, pour it into a bowl and refrigerate it. The next day, it makes a great base for soup once you scoop the fat from the top.

Modifications.modification: Instead of using the Sauce recipe, just use a bottle of store-bought BBQ Sauce, such as Tony Roma's or Sweet Baby Rays.
